verses.kjv: Now Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David. His son Jehoram became king in his place.

verses.kjv: And he had brethren the sons of Jehoshaphat, Azariah, and Jehiel, and Zechariah, and Azariah, and Michael, and Shephatiah: all these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
verses.ct: Jehoram had brothers who were also sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azariah, Michael, and Shephatiah. All of these were sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.

verses.kjv: And their father gave them great gifts of silver, and of gold, and of precious things, with fenced cities in Judah: but the kingdom gave he to Jehoram; because he was the firstborn.
verses.ct: Their father had given them generous gifts of silver, gold, and valuable items, along with fortified cities in Judah. But he gave the kingdom to Jehoram because he was the firstborn.

verses.kjv: Now when Jehoram was risen up to the kingdom of his father, he strengthened himself, and slew all his brethren with the sword, and divers also of the princes of Israel.
verses.ct: Once Jehoram had established himself as king over his father's kingdom, he killed all of his brothers with the sword, along with some of the officials of Israel.

verses.kjv: Jehoram was thirty and two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Jehoram was 32 years old when he became king, and he ruled for 8 years in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, like as did the house of Ahab: for he had the daughter of Ahab to wife: and he wrought that which was evil in the eyes of the LORD.
verses.ct: He followed the practices of the kings of Israel, just as the family of Ahab had done, because he had married a daughter of Ahab. He did what was evil in the LORD's sight.

verses.kjv: Howbeit the LORD would not destroy the house of David, because of the covenant that he had made with David, and as he promised to give a light to him and to his sons for ever.
verses.ct: Yet the LORD was not willing to destroy the house of David, because of the covenant he had made with David, and because he had promised to maintain a light for him and his descendants forever.

verses.kjv: In his days the Edomites revolted from under the dominion of Judah, and made themselves a king.
verses.ct: During Jehoram's reign, the Edomites rebelled against Judah's control and appointed their own king.

verses.kjv: Then Jehoram went forth with his princes, and all his chariots with him: and he rose up by night, and smote the Edomites which compassed him in, and the captains of the chariots.
verses.ct: So Jehoram marched out with his commanders and all his chariots. He launched a night attack and struck the Edomites who had surrounded him, along with their chariot commanders.

verses.kjv: So the Edomites revolted from under the hand of Judah unto this day. The same time also did Libnah revolt from under his hand; because he had forsaken the LORD God of his fathers.
verses.ct: Even so, Edom has remained free from Judah's control to this day. At that same time, Libnah also rebelled against his authority, because Jehoram had abandoned the LORD, the God of his ancestors.

verses.kjv: Moreover he made high places in the mountains of Judah, and caused the inhabitants of Jerusalem to commit fornication, and compelled Judah thereto.
verses.ct: He also built worship sites on the hills of Judah, led the people of Jerusalem into spiritual unfaithfulness, and dragged Judah into it as well.

verses.kjv: And there came a writing to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, Thus saith the LORD God of David thy father, Because thou hast not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat thy father, nor in the ways of Asa king of Judah,
verses.ct: Then a letter came to him from Elijah the prophet, which said: "This is what the LORD, the God of your ancestor David, says: Because you have not followed the ways of your father Jehoshaphat or the ways of King Asa of Judah,

verses.kjv: But hast walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and hast made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to go a whoring, like to the whoredoms of the house of Ahab, and also hast slain thy brethren of thy father’s house, which were better than thyself:
verses.ct: but instead have followed the practices of the kings of Israel, and have led Judah and the people of Jerusalem into spiritual unfaithfulness just like the family of Ahab did, and because you have also killed your own brothers from your father's family — men who were better than you —

verses.kjv: Behold, with a great plague will the LORD smite thy people, and thy children, and thy wives, and all thy goods:
verses.ct: pay attention: the LORD is going to strike your people, your children, your wives, and everything you own with a terrible plague.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt have great sickness by disease of thy bowels, until thy bowels fall out by reason of the sickness day by day.
verses.ct: You yourself will suffer from a severe disease of your intestines, and day after day the illness will worsen until your intestines come out because of the disease."

verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines, and of the Arabians, that were near the Ethiopians:
verses.ct: Then the LORD stirred up hostility against Jehoram from the Philistines and from the Arabs who lived near the Ethiopians.

verses.kjv: And they came up into Judah, and brake into it, and carried away all the substance that was found in the king’s house, and his sons also, and his wives; so that there was never a son left him, save Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.
verses.ct: They invaded Judah, broke through its defenses, and carried off everything of value found in the royal palace, including his sons and his wives. No son was left to him except Jehoahaz, his youngest.

verses.kjv: And after all this the LORD smote him in his bowels with an incurable disease.
verses.ct: After all of this, the LORD struck him with an incurable disease in his intestines.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that in process of time, after the end of two years, his bowels fell out by reason of his sickness: so he died of sore diseases. And his people made no burning for him, like the burning of his fathers.
verses.ct: As time went on, after about 2 years, his intestines came out because of the disease, and he died in terrible agony. His people did not make a funeral fire in his honor the way they had done for his ancestors.

verses.kjv: Thirty and two years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years, and departed without being desired. Howbeit they buried him in the city of David, but not in the sepulchres of the kings.
verses.ct: He was 32 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 8 years. He passed away with no one mourning his loss. They buried him in the city of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.
